Program Outcomes

Strengthened surveillance and reporting pathways
Earlier risk identification in local settings
Improved quality of public health data for decision-making
Expanded local workforce confidence in epidemiology tools

title: Impact
text:
Field Stories

District Surveillance Strengthening
A district team moved from fragmented records to structured surveillance reporting, reducing reporting delays and improving response coordination.


Training-to-Practice Model
Student and early-career cohorts adopted reproducible workflows and applied them in operational public health projects.

title: About EpiPulse
text: EpiPulse is a public health non-governmental organization focused on translating evidence into action. We support communities and institutions through epidemiological intelligence, program implementation, and applied training.

title: About EpiPulse
text: EpiPulse is a public health non-governmental organization focused on translating evidence into action. We support communities and institutions through epidemiological intelligence, program implementation, and applied training.

title: About EpiPulse
text:
Vision
To build healthier, resilient, and equitable communities by transforming public health evidence into sustainable action.

title: About EpiPulse
text:
Mission

Generate and translate high-quality public health evidence for informed decisions
Strengthen community-based prevention and health promotion
Support health systems through research, training, and technical assistance
Promote equity, ethics, and One Health approaches in practice

title: About EpiPulse
text:
Values

Scientific integrity
Equity and ethics
Collaboration
Community engagement
Impact orientation

title: EpiPulse
text:
EpiPulse is a public health NGO working at the intersection of epidemiology, community engagement, and implementation science. We turn health data into practical action for stronger and more equitable communities.
Donate Now Get Involved

title: EpiPulse
text:
At a Glance


32
Active districts engaged


58
Field projects completed


14,500+
Community members reached


120+
Professionals and students trained

title: EpiPulse
text:
What We Do


Epidemiology and Surveillance
Data-driven surveillance support, outbreak analytics, and actionable dashboards for local decision-makers.


Non-Communicable Disease Prevention
Community interventions for diabetes, hypertension, nutrition, and behavior-risk reduction.


Maternal, Child, and Adolescent Health
Field research and implementation support for life-course health and school/community prevention.


Capacity Building
Workshops, mentoring, and reproducible data workflows for students, researchers, and frontline teams.

title: EpiPulse
text:
Why Partners Work With EpiPulse
We combine rigorous methods with practical implementation. Our model supports governments, institutions, and communities with:

Fast evidence synthesis for decision-making
Ethical and equity-centered public health practice
Cross-disciplinary teams (epidemiology, clinical, analytics, field operations)
Transparent documentation and reproducible methods

title: EpiPulse
text:
Stories From the Field

“EpiPulse helped our district team move from raw records to a clear action plan in weeks, not months.” Local Program Partner


“The mentorship and tools made our resident training program immediately more practical.” Academic Collaborator

title: Programs
text:
Disease surveillance design, outbreak support, risk assessment, and rapid analytics for action.



Research and interventions on hypertension, diabetes, nutrition, and lifestyle-risk reduction.



Community programs, nutrition assessment, school health, and implementation support.



Assessment of climate, workplace exposure, and environmental determinants of health.



Integrated human-animal-environment public health approaches for emerging threats.



Training, mentorship, and workforce support for students and public health professionals.

title: Programs
text:
How We Work

Assess local context and public health priorities
Co-design interventions with community and institutional partners
Implement with clear monitoring indicators
Measure outcomes and continuously improve

title: Public Health Data Analysis Resources
text: This page curates learning resources for reproducible and ethics-aware public health data workflows.

title: Public Health Data Analysis Resources
text: This page curates learning resources for reproducible and ethics-aware public health data workflows.

title: Public Health Data Analysis Resources
text:
What You Can Use

AI-assisted data cleaning workflow templates
Data typing and labeling guidance
Export pathways for R, SPSS, and Stata
Beginner-friendly implementation notes for public health teams

title: Public Health Data Analysis Resources
text:
Recommended Use Path

Prepare de-identified datasets
Use structured templates for cleaning and validation
Review all AI-assisted code before execution
Document assumptions and decisions
Export reproducible outputs with data dictionaries
